strategies.useOfSavingsAvoidance: In FY16 OPE IDC has transitioned their effort from consolidation of the annual performance reporting applications to upgrading the applications to a COTS solution and migrating the applications to a cloud data center. Due to transition costs associated with these initiatives, OPE does not expect to see any cost savings/avoidances in FY16, but should begin seeing cost savings/avoidances in FY17 and significant cost savings/avoidances beyond FY17 as the applications are migrated and upgraded.

strategies.useOfSavingsAvoidance: The Department intends to invest savings back into the common web platform.  Current project is to reduce CMS’s from 3 to 1 by September 30, 2019.  Cost reduction will be calculated then in terms of hosting, licensing, O & M and support staff.

strategies.strategyTitle: Enterprise License Use, Consolidation and Management
strategies.useOfSavingsAvoidance: Software Licensing (M-16-12): As an initial step to optimizing the acquisition to software licenses, ED has consolidated all software licensing related investments into one non-major IT investment. The consolidation will aid in the identification of any duplication in software acquisition. As a next step, as the term of the licenses expire ED will evaluate the suitability of participating in the government-wide enterprise software licenses and government-wide blanket purchase agreements as appropriate to acquire replacement software licenses.
The Department intends to reinvest cost savings and avoidance to further enhance IT mobility, streamline additional costs and implement innovative IT solutions.
